intro: Canthium chinense, commonly known as Chinese spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
